Value statement

As a financial advisor at RBC Wealth Management, I provide clients with three basic services:

• I help increase income, build wealth and lower taxes.

• I pride myself on building close personal relationships with my clients. By knowing each client’s individual situation, I am better able to help them meet their financial goals.

• I enjoy educating my clients and their families about the benefits of long term investing. As educated investors, my clients learn to ignore short-term market volatility, and focus on the benefits long-term investing.

Approach to wealth management

Through close and consistent communication, I tailor an investment strategy that fits each client’s current and long-term investment goals. My process includes:

• Understanding your financial objectives — I listen to you in order to gain an understanding of your long-term financial goals.

• Gather your current financial information — Together, we gather specific information on your financial picture.

• Recommend suitable investment options — Based on your financial goals, your past investment experiences and the current economic and market situation, I build a portfolio you are comfortable and confident owning. I always explain why each component of your portfolio is timely, and why I believe it is suitable for you.

• Providing timely, ongoing service and advice — As your portfolio and personal situation evolves, I give you consistent updates on performance and new suitable investment opportunities that help you meet your financial objectives.

Qualifications

I started in the securities business immediately after graduating from college in 1988, and I have obtained my Series 7, 63 and 65 investment registrations. I tailor my services to each client’s needs and desires: For clients wanting a hands-on approach, I only recommend investments that are suitable to help achieve their long-term goals. For clients who wish to rely fully on my expertise and experience, I manage accounts through the RBC Wealth Management Portfolio Focus program. This is a personalized portfolio management program which only a select group of RBC Wealth Management Advisors qualify for. Through the Portfolio Focus program, I can make investment decisions on your behalf, which allows you to simplify your life by not having to make complicated investment decisions.

I provide individual and corporate investors a broad spectrum of financial services with an emphasis on specialized portfolio management. With over 30 years of investment experience, I combine my financial knowledge with a dedication to my clients’ individual needs. By developing a close working relationship with my clients, I help create portfolios that are a true reflection of each client’s investment temperament and financial objectives.

Qualifications
With over 30 years of experience, I have been helping clients achieve their financial goals. I specialize in creating retirement spending plans for clients entering their retirement age by using a customized approach to developing and managing their wealth. I help build financial independence and a comfortable retirement. I graduated from the University of California, Berkeley, in 1977 with a bachelor’s degree in political science. Today my professional registrations include the Series 7, 8, 63 and 65 licenses. Through an internal RBC Wealth Management program, I earned the Accredited Wealth Manager designation. The program builds on the fundamentals of wealth management with a focus on advanced knowledge and skills necessary for working with high net worth clients. I am also a member of the IAG (Investment Advisor Group) Advisory Council, whose mission is to provide strategic guidance and input on how best to grow, service, and support fee-based business.

Personal
I reside in downtown San Jose with my wife, Susan, and have two married daughters and two grandchildren. I also enjoy traveling the world with my family, and golfing. I am a CAL football fanatic and a Sharks, Giants and 49ers fan.

Biography:
Bill Cariker understands what lies at the core of this important work that he does every day for his clients at RBC Wealth Management: “I’m tasked with being a good steward with my client’s money. It’s as simple as that,” he says. “They’re counting on me to get it right.”

Bill was born in Denver but grew up in mostly rural south Texas. His father and mother ran Varner-Hogg State Park, a 52 acre spread near West Columbia, Texas for over a quarter century. He learned from both of them the value of finishing the task at hand, no matter how difficult, and that has served him well at every station in life.

He graduated from Southwestern University with a degree in Biology and Chemistry. He would spend a few years with Dow Chemical as a Technical Service Chemist before embarking on a 23-year career with Merrill Lynch. While at Merrill Lynch, he took on the 2-year task of getting his CFP, or Certified Financial Planner designation.

Along the way, Bill also found the time to complete an MBA at Texas A&M University.

He arrived at RBC Wealth Management a little over three years ago, and he admits with a healthy dose of humility that he is one of the lucky ones, because this role gives him a chance to do what he does best every day. “I love to learn, and I really like sharing what I learn with my clients,” he says. “This is a partnership, and the good people I  work for need a steady hand on the wheel. I believe I provide that.”

He has always admired country doctors, those selfless souls who dedicate their lives to the health of their communities. His grandfather was a doctor, and one of his mentors was as well. Bill once even thought about going into the medical field himself.

Instead, he has devoted his life to the financial health of his clients, and frankly, he cares as much as any physician ever cared for a patient. His knowledge allows  him to administer preventative medicine to keep their portfolios healthy and vibrant.

It’s a mission he relishes, and it too has some unforgettable moments. “I’ve had people invite me to a house warming and stand up in front of everyone and say ‘This is the house that Bill made possible.’ And, I get to see parents send their kids off to college without all the financial stress that often accompanies it, just because we made good decisions along the way. It doesn’t get any better than that.” 

Bill is married to Lynne, and they live in Austin, Texas.

Biography:
Bill Cariker understands what lies at the core of this important work that he does every day for his clients at RBC Wealth Management: “I’m tasked with being a good steward with my client’s money. It’s as simple as that,” he says. “They’re counting on me to get it right.”

Bill was born in Denver but grew up in mostly rural south Texas. His father and mother ran Varner-Hogg State Park, a 52 acre spread near West Columbia, Texas for over a quarter century. He learned from both of them the value of finishing the task at hand, no matter how difficult, and that has served him well at every station in life.

He graduated from Southwestern University with a degree in Biology and Chemistry. He would spend a few years with Dow Chemical as a Technical Service Chemist before embarking on a 23-year career with Merrill Lynch. While at Merrill Lynch, he took on the 2-year task of getting his CFP, or Certified Financial Planner designation.

Along the way, Bill also found the time to complete an MBA at Texas A&M University.

He arrived at RBC Wealth Management a little over three years ago, and he admits with a healthy dose of humility that he is one of the lucky ones, because this role gives him a chance to do what he does best every day. “I love to learn, and I really like sharing what I learn with my clients,” he says. “This is a partnership, and the good people I  work for need a steady hand on the wheel. I believe I provide that.”

He has always admired country doctors, those selfless souls who dedicate their lives to the health of their communities. His grandfather was a doctor, and one of his mentors was as well. Bill once even thought about going into the medical field himself.

Instead, he has devoted his life to the financial health of his clients, and frankly, he cares as much as any physician ever cared for a patient. His knowledge allows  him to administer preventative medicine to keep their portfolios healthy and vibrant.

It’s a mission he relishes, and it too has some unforgettable moments. “I’ve had people invite me to a house warming and stand up in front of everyone and say ‘This is the house that Bill made possible.’ And, I get to see parents send their kids off to college without all the financial stress that often accompanies it, just because we made good decisions along the way. It doesn’t get any better than that.” 

Bill is married to Lynne, and they live in Austin, Texas.
